quoteFirst: At a quarter past one, two of our ships to windward exchanged a good many shots with the enemy. At half-past one the Admiral made our signal to close; twenty-five past one, we began to engage; at fifty past one the Admiral made the signal to the Monarch to get into her station. At
quoteLast: he made the Alert signal to come within hail; half-past two he made the Royal Oak's signal to take the ship in tow that had struck her colours. At twenty-two past two the Admiral made the Resolution signal to tack, and we discontinued engaging.
title: Memoirs and Correspondence of Admiral Lord de Saumarez. Vol II
author: Ross, John, Sir, 1777-1856

quoteFirst: On Tuesday, June 20 of that year, at
quoteLast: , King William the Fourth died. The Archbishop of Canterbury and the Lord Chamberlain set out at once for Kensington to convey the sad news.
title: Queen Victoria
author: Browne, E. Gordon (Edgar Gordon), 1871-

quoteFirst: Then the lights went out all over the city. It happened at
title: The haunter of the dark
author: Lovecraft, H. P. (Howard Phillips), 1890-1937

quoteFirst: Uncle, the King, expired this morning at
title: The letters of Queen Victoria, vol. 1, 1837-1843
author: Victoria, Queen of Great Britain, 1819-1901; Benson, Arthur Christopher, 1862-1925 [Editor]; Esher, Reginald Baliol Brett, Viscount, 1852-1930 [Editor]

quoteFirst: I got out of bed and went into my sitting-room (only in my dressing-gown) and _alone_, and saw them. Lord Conyngham (the Lord Chamberlain) then acquainted me that my poor Uncle, the King, was no more, and had expired at
quoteLast: this morning, and consequently that I am _Queen_. Lord Conyngham knelt down and kissed my hand, at the same time delivering to me the official announcement of the poor King's demise.
title: The letters of Queen Victoria, vol. 1, 1837-1843
author: Victoria, Queen of Great Britain, 1819-1901; Benson, Arthur Christopher, 1862-1925 [Editor]; Esher, Reginald Baliol Brett, Viscount, 1852-1930 [Editor]

quoteLast: ; I’m not detaining you?” he asked, with a broad suggestion of sarcasm.
title: The Arrival of Jimpson, and Other Stories for Boys about Boys
author: Barbour, Ralph Henry, 1870-1944
